zone.line: of the custom
He wags his tail. all houn dogs do
Faust
Accompany thyself to us! come here!
Wagner
It is a blundering foolish beast.
Thou standest still he waits too;
Thou speakest him to, he struggles to thee ?on, ?on,
Loose what, he would it bring
After thy stick in the water would spring
Faust
Thou hast well, I find not the step
Of a ghost, & all is ( )
With Wagner
to a dog , when he well pulls
Will himself a wise man weigh
Yes, thy affection desires he quite & entirely
He, of students the most excellent scholar
in
